frontmatter.titlepage:
Culinary Pamphlet Collection, c.1900-1975
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms2011-002
Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University 2011 &contact;
Processed by: Kira A. Dietz, Acquisitions and Processing Archivist,
Special Collections

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection includes small publications and pamphlets created and distributed by culinary, appliance, and food-related companies from about 1900 to 1975. Most pamphlets contain advertisements, recipes, product information, testimonials, or some combination of all four.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Culinary Pamphlet Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Culinary Pamphlet Collection, Ms2011-002, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The initial materials in this collection were part of two separate donations given to Special Collections in 2010. Additional accruals are expected in the future.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the initial donations comprising the Culinary Pamphlet Collection was completed in January 2011. Additional description is expected as materials are added to the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Culinary Pamphlet Collection is an artificial collection created in January 2011. The collection includes small publications and pamphlets created and distributed by culinary, appliance, and other food-related companies from about 1900 to 1975. Most pamphlets contain advertisements, recipes, product information, testimonials, or some combination of all four.

The collection represents a diverse set of companies and products. Examples include items from the World War II era with recipes and tips for rationing and substituting for "Victory," publications featuring recipes using a specific kitchen appliance, weight loss hints from the National Dairy Council, and recipe books produced by heating and air conditioning vendors as advertising. The majority of titles in the collection relate to specific food products, especially flour, baking powder, baking soda, and various gelatines like Knox and Jell-O.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Publications and pamphlets are sorted by the name of the parent companies. Companies are arranged in alphabetical order. Since many companies changed names over time, an effort has been made to provide as many company names as possible. The earliest known company is listed first with subsequent names in parentheses.

Within each parent company, pamphlets are in chronological order. Each folder includes a bibliography of pamphlet and publication titles, dates, and authors, where known. Cross-references to other companies are listed at the folder level, if applicable.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections also houses more than 2,400 publications as part of the Culinary History Collection. Titles can be found by searching the library's catalog, Addison.
American Egg Board Collection, Ms2009-124. Finding aid available on the Virginia Heritage database.
Ballard & Ballard Company Collection, Ms2010-032. Finding aid available on the Virginia Heritage database.
Quality Chemical Company Collection, Ms2010-039. Finding aid available on the Virginia Heritage database.
National and State Agricultural Publications, Ms2011-022. Finding aid available on the Virginia Heritage database.
